pageContext.claim: “Saved that [coal] industry. That industry was gone. And it's a very important -- really, a very important asset for our country. That industry was gone. It was going to be out. And we would’ve had a big problem if it was gone. And they have great people in that industry. And that’s what they want to do, right?”
pageContext.analysis: This is mostly baloney. The U.S. has added nearly 2,000 coal mining jobs since Trump took office, according to the Bureau of Labor Statistics. That's a drop in the bucket when measured against the 125,000-job loss in this industry since its most recent peak in 1985, or the 36,000-job loss since 2012.
